Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Dot goes outside.

English (United States)(en-US): 오늘도 무사히 돌아올 수 있을런지. 쌍안경으로 뭉치를 구경해 볼까?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I hope Dot has a safe journey home... Perhaps I'll spy on them with my binoculars.
Thump... Thump... Splat.

English (United States)(en-US): 인간들을 구경하고 올게. 그동안 내 친구 곰팡이의 혼잣말을 지켜봐 줘!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I'm going to observe some humans. Meanwhile, please look over my mold friend's mumblings!
Today, I failed to go outside.

English (United States)(en-US): 내 녹아 버린 몸을 너는 보지 않았으면 좋겠어. 절대 문을 열지 말아 줘.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I don't want you ever to see me in my melted state. Please, don't open the door.
Maybe I'll lose my way?

English (United States)(en-US): 뭉치를 되찾기에 지구는 너무 넓다. 뭉치... 괜찮을까?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): The Earth is too far and wide to find Dot. Will Dot be... Okay?
A monster who couldn't go outside.

English (United States)(en-US): 나의 회갈색 모퉁이는 사념의 요새야. 잠시만, 잠시만 녹아 있을게.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): My grey-brown corner is a fortress of contemplation. Leave me be in my melted state, just for a while.
A black blob falling out the window?

English (United States)(en-US): 작은 쪽지를 남겨 두었어. 금방 다녀올게, <nickname>!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I left a little note. I'll be back soon, <nickname>!
Could it be... Dot?

English (United States)(en-US): 인근 초등학교 등굣길, 몇몇 학생들이 정체불명의 검은 괴물을 포착했다는 소식입니다.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Breaking news: Several sightings of an unidentified black monster near the local elementary school have been reported.

English (United States)(en-US): 혹시 너, 청소라는 걸 했어? 에이... 설마. 설마. 아니지?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Um, by any chance, have you done what's called 'cleaning'?
I feel a bit strange today.

English (United States)(en-US): 밖에 나가면 안 될 것 같은 예감... 그래도 가 봐야겠지.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I have a bad feeling... But I should go anyway.
My footprints are melting.

English (United States)(en-US): 흔적도 없이 사라지는 건 조금 외로운 일이야.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Disappearing without a trace is a bit lonely.
Fog. Thick fog.

English (United States)(en-US): 앞이 안 보여도 괜찮아. 집으로 가는 길은 외웠거든.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I can't see ahead... But I memorized the way home.
Today feels extra far.

English (United States)(en-US): 다리가 없는데 왜 다리가 아픈 걸까?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I don't have legs. So why do they hurt?
My last walk will be in my mind.
When I close my eyes, I see the universe.
You know, I have something to tell you!

English (United States)(en-US): 그건..., 그건..., 그건.... 어어, 나 왜 이러지?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): That is... That is... That is... Uh-oh, what's happening to me?

English (United States)(en-US): 큰일이야. 이러다간 다 타 버리고 말겠어.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): This is serious. If nothing changes, it will all burn down.

English (United States)(en-US): 마음속에 집채만 한 불길이 있는 사람을 봤어!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): There was a colossal fire within him. How did it come to this?
Choose your face.

English (United States)(en-US): 오늘은 이런 머리를 쓰면 어떨 것 같아?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): How do you fell about putting on this head today?
The kind of day you want to stand under a metaphorical umbrella.

English (United States)(en-US): 뭉치는 우울할 때면 눈이 사라지는 괴물인 것 같다...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Dot's eyes seem to disappear when they're feeling melancholy...

English (United States)(en-US): 파티에 와 줄 수 있겠어? 늦었지만!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Will you come to the party? I know it's a bit late, but still!

English (United States)(en-US): 분명 공들여 준비했을 축제의 끝을 바라봐야 하니까.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Because I have to face the end of this festival you undoubtedly have put much effort into.
[Unable to Connect]

English (United States)(en-US): 네가 궁금해! 너와 더 가까워지고 싶어.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I want to get to know you so much more than I do now!
I've become a dustball.
It stings a bit, but maybe that's not all that bad?
Twins inside the esophagus.
Something is squirming in their throat.
Huh? What's going on?
When's the last time you saw the mold?

English (United States)(en-US): 안녕. 서둘러 와서 이걸 닫아 줘.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Hello. Please hurry and shut this.

English (United States)(en-US): 안녕. 서둘러 와서 이걸 닫아 줘.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Hello. Please hurry and shut this.
What if you were to live in yesterday's dream forever?
I'm going to tell you a story about a dream that never disappears.
I don't want you to come by today.

English (United States)(en-US): 들키기 싫은 모습을 하고 있을 테니까. (거짓말이야.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I'll be in a state I don't want anyone to witness. (It's a lie.)
After farewell remains...

English (United States)(en-US): 파도가 지나간 해변 위 조개껍데기처럼 빛나는 슬픔.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): A sparkling sadness, like shells swept up the beach by waves.
The day the last grain of sand drops.

English (United States)(en-US): 우주에서 가장 멋진 작별 인사를 나누자!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Let's have the greatest farewell in the universe!
I know I'm just a measly black monster.

English (United States)(en-US): 사랑한다는 말을 꼭 해 보고 싶어. 그러니 지금, 네가 필요해!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): But I want to tell you I love you. So I need you, right now!
Splat. (Rolling...) Splat. (Rolling...)

English (United States)(en-US): 벽에 더 잘 매달리고 싶은데... 무슨 방법이 없을까?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I'd like to stick to the wall a little better... Any ideas?
What do you think is inside the white hat?

English (United States)(en-US): 분필 눈으로 보니, 평범한 머리로 보이기만 하는데 말야.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): With my chalk-drawn eyes, it only seems like a normal head.

English (United States)(en-US): 레드에게 직접 물어볼 수는 없는 이야기야...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): It's something I can't ask Red myself...
So can you listen instead of me?
You could die one day too?

English (United States)(en-US): 잘 모르지만... 그럴 수도 있겠다는 생각이 들었어.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I'm not sure but... I thought it could be. Am I right?
[No Connection]
Am I the only one longing?
Dot turns into a great big dustball...
But it's really not so bad. Do you want to come check me out?
Spit it out. Spit it out.

English (United States)(en-US): 하지만 여전히 방법을 모르겠어. 도와 줄래?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): But I don't know how. Will you help me?

English (United States)(en-US): 어디에도 보이지 않아! 미칠 것 같아.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I can't find it anywhere!

English (United States)(en-US): 대체 어디로 '사라져 버린' 거야. 나의 소중한 친구.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Where did my precious friend 'disappear' to?

English (United States)(en-US): 안녕. 서둘러 서둘러 와 와서 '이걸' 닫아줘.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Hello. Hurry, hurry, come and shut 'this'.
Please shut this for me? I'm begging you.
In certain dreams, you know...

English (United States)(en-US): 사랑하는 사람이 기다리고 있어. '사람'은 아니지만, 나도 널 기다려.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Someone you love is waiting. I'm not a 'someone', but I'm waiting for you too!
That's okay. You don't have to come.

English (United States)(en-US): 내가 녹아가는 속도는 그다지 빠르지 않은 것 같네.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): The speed at which I'm melting doesn't seem that fast.

English (United States)(en-US): 창가에 앉으면 보이는 커다란 나무 알지?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): You know the big tree you can see from the window?

English (United States)(en-US): 오늘은 그 나무에 대한 이야기를 들려주려 해.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Today I want to tell you a story about that tree.
I'm ready.

English (United States)(en-US): 그러니 너와 세상 너머를 바라보고 싶어. 저어기 너머를.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): So I want to gaze beyond the world with you. Way beyond there.

English (United States)(en-US): 뭉치가 책더미 속에서 흐물흐물 기어 나옵니다...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Dot oozes out from a pile of books...

English (United States)(en-US): 나, 사랑에 대하여 깨달은 게 있어.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I've realized something about love.
Emptiness...

English (United States)(en-US): 채우려 할수록 더 비어가는 것들이 있어.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Some things grow emptier the more you try to fill them.
Okay. I'm completely ready.

English (United States)(en-US): 너의 본모습을 관찰할 수 있게 해줘.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Let me observe your true self.
Dot carefully calls for you...

English (United States)(en-US): 거기에 있어? 하고 싶은 말이 있어. 실은... 네 도움이 필요해.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Are you there? Well... I need your help.
Hurry to me.

English (United States)(en-US): 언젠가 죽게 될 너에게, 긴히 전할 말이 있어!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I have something urgent to tell you!
Hurry to me.

English (United States)(en-US): 언젠가 죽게 될 너에게, 긴히 전할 말이 있어!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I have something urgent to tell you—you who will someday die.
Dot sits quietly in place.

English (United States)(en-US): 고요 속에 숨은, 원인 모를 불협화음을 들을 수 있나요?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Can you hear the strange discord hiding in the silence?
(The closet feels darker than usual today.)
Something I had to hold back.
Still holding it in? Or did you finally let it out?
About the mold... I'm over it now.

English (United States)(en-US): 그런데 꿈에 대해 마음에 걸리는 점이 있어.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): But something about that dream keeps bothering me.
I'm going to tell a dark story.

English (United States)(en-US): 꼭 짚어야 하는 내용이거든. 너만 괜찮다면 계속할까?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): It needs to be told. Shall I go on if you're okay?
The trap of sweet illusion.

English (United States)(en-US): 그림자가 다가올 때면 그 덫에 몸을 던지고 싶어져.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): When shadows approach I want to throw myself into it.
Into the vast darkness.
I'm sinking. Or am I actually rising?

English (United States)(en-US): 기억 나? 내가 떠나려고 했던 날.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Remember? The day I tried to leave.
All those memories and moments.
At the very end.
What color is the dream waiting for us?
Waiting so desperately for you.

English (United States)(en-US): 사랑에 대해 퐁 솟은 깨달음이 있단 말야. 들어주지 않을래?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I had a sudden epiphany about love. Won't you hear it?
Ah. My ring boy.
I want to continue his story.

English (United States)(en-US): 너도 혼자 있고 싶은 게 아니라면
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): If you don't want to be alone either
Let's keep talking. I'm waiting for you.
Dot has gone flat like a plate.

English (United States)(en-US): 뭉치는 홀로 조금 고통스러운 시간을 보낸 걸지도 몰라요.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Dot may have spent some painful time alone.
More time has slipped away.

English (United States)(en-US): 그만큼 내가 사랑하는 인간인 <nickname>, 너의 죽음도... 가까워진 걸까?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Does that mean your death draws nearer too, <nickname>—you whom I love?
We're so far apart.
I don't even know why you're not coming.
(Gone forever? If you never come back...)
Even if it's suppressed.
Talking with you is my precious release.

English (United States)(en-US): 아무리 믿을래도 믿을 수 없는 것
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Something I can't believe no matter how I try.

English (United States)(en-US): 꿈을 꾸는 꿈에 대해 생각하고 있어.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I'm thinking about a dream within a dream.
Okay. I'll wait.

English (United States)(en-US): '검은 것'에 대해 얘기해도 네가 괜찮을 때에 나를 찾아줘.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Come find me when you're ready to talk about 'the dark thing'.
I have a confession.
The time we spend together, maybe it's also...
The darkness is drawing near.

English (United States)(en-US): 그 오랜 이야기를 네게 들려 줄게.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Let me tell you that old story.
How will you remember me?

English (United States)(en-US): 너의 시간 속에 각인될 내가 궁금해.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I wonder what I'll look like etched in your time.
Let's be together.
For all the words still left unsaid.

English (United States)(en-US): 오늘을 정리할 시 한 편을 들고 왔어.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I brought a poem to wrap up today.

English (United States)(en-US): 너와 공유할 수 있다면 좋을 텐데!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I wish I could share it with you!
I heard humans cry when they yawn.

English (United States)(en-US): 조심해야겠어. 나의 분필 눈이 지워질지도 모르니!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): I should be careful. My chalk eyes might smudge!

English (United States)(en-US): 잠들기 전 시를 읽을 수 있다면
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): If I could read a poem before sleep
I'd be so, so happy!

English (United States)(en-US): 그것 알아? 자기 전에 읽는 시가...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Did you know? A poem before bed...
Actually helps you have good dreams!

English (United States)(en-US):
<오늘의 시>가 준비됐어.",Poem's ready.
push_night_5,이제 네가 오기만 하면 돼!,Now I just need you to come!
push_title_night_6,눈이 자꾸 감기지만.,My eyes keep closing...
push_night_6,절대 잠들지 않겠어. 내 인간 친구가 돌아올 때까지는
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 절대!"
column4: But I won't sleep yet. Not until you come!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): Today's poem is special.
It'll be even more special if we read it together!
dummy
dummy
dummy
dummy
dummy
dummy
dummy
dummy
dummy
dummy
dummy

English (United States)(en-US): 뭉치가 외롭게 녹아내린 것 같다. 이대로 뭉치의 삶은 끝나는 걸까?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): dummy
dummy
dummy
